marketNews.title: BI Rate Held at 4.75% Level, Against Expectations
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia on Wednesday (10/22) maintained the BI Rate at 4.75%, contrary to consensus expectations which predicted a cut of -25 bps. The lending facility and deposit facility were also maintained at 5.5% and 3.75% respectively. Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, stated that they still see room for further interest rate cuts, but Bank Indonesia's current focus is on maintaining the stability of the Rupiah exchange rate and strengthening the effectiveness of the monetary policy transmission already undertaken. Perry urged banks to accelerate the reduction of lending rates. Perry mentioned that the BI Rate has decreased by -150 bps since September 2024, but bank lending rates have only dropped -15 bps from 9.20% at the beginning of 2025 to 9.05% in September 2025. A similar trend occurred with third-party fund (TPF) rates, which only fell -29 bps from 4.81% to 4.52%, mainly due to the still high issuance of special rates to large depositors, reaching 26% of total banking TPF. To accelerate monetary policy transmission, Bank Indonesia will expand the provisions for macroprudential liquidity incentives starting from December 1, 2025, by providing incentives for banks that reduce their lending rates. The incentive provided will be a maximum of 0.5% of TPF, dependent on the elasticity of the related bank's lending rate reduction relative to the cut in the BI Rate. Meanwhile, liquidity incentives related to providing credit to priority sectors remain at 5% of TPF, but will be implemented on a forward-looking basis (unlike the previous backward-looking approach), based on future credit disbursement commitments. This change is expected to drive faster credit growth. Bank Indonesia's decision to maintain the interest rate occurred amidst the shrinkage of Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves to the level of 148.7 billion US dollars as of the end of September 2025, marking the third consecutive monthly decline and the lowest level in the last 14 months. The decrease in foreign exchange reserves potentially limits Bank Indonesia's room to support the stability of the Rupiah exchange rate. Key Takeaway: Besides focusing on the effectiveness of monetary policy transmission, the decision to maintain the BI Rate was also made ahead of the meeting between US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping, scheduled to take place at the APEC Summit on October 31-November 1, 2025, the developments of which may affect market volatility and outlook.

tickerNews.title: FUTR Partners for 130 MW Solar Power Plant Development
tickerNews.content: $FUTR: Futura Energi Global signed a strategic cooperation memorandum of understanding with Zhejiang Energy PV-Tech Co. Ltd. and PT Hypec International to develop a 130 MW solar power plant (PLTS) project in Bali. FUTR President Director, Tonny Agus Mulyantono, stated that they are currently coordinating with the local government of Bali to determine a construction location suitable for spatial planning needs and local potential. Tonny added that FUTR will later establish a dedicated subsidiary to handle the operation and maintenance of the PLTS project. FUTR targets the completion of documentation, feasibility study, and licensing stages in 1H26, so that the project can immediately enter the construction phase.

tickerNews.title: Bank Mandiri seeks EGM to decide on BSI Spin-off
tickerNews.content: $BMRI: Kontan reported that Danantara is currently seeking a schedule to hold an Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) for Bank Mandiri to decide on the spin-off plan of Bank Syariah Indonesia ($BRIS) from $BMRI. After this corporate action plan is complete, $BRIS will be under the direct control of Danantara. Kontan sources mentioned that the implementation of the RUPSLB is sought to be held this year. Responding to this issue, BRIS President Director, Anggoro Eko Cahyo, stated that the spin-off plan is the authority of the shareholders.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Cooperates with CENT and TBIG after winning 1.4 GHz frequency auction
tickerNews.content: $WIFI: Digital Solution Director, Shannedy Ong, stated that they are collaborating with Tower Bersama Infrastructure ($TBIG) and PT Centratama Menara Indonesia, a subsidiary of Centratama Telekomunikasi Indonesia ($CENT), to develop broadband wireless access. This collaboration was established after $WIFI won the auction for the use of the 1.4 GHz radio frequency band in regional area 1. With this cooperation, Shannedy mentioned that $WIFI does not need to build towers to develop the internet network. If $WIFI's infrastructure needs are not yet met, Shannedy said that they potentially will collaborate with Dayamitra Telekomunikasi ($MTEL) or Sarana Menara Nusantara ($TOWR).

tickerNews.title: RAJA Subsidiary to Acquire Gas Trading Company; RAJA Conducts Due Diligence for Shipping and EBT Acquisitions
tickerNews.content: $RAJA: Rukun Raharja, in an information disclosure regarding public expose material, mentioned that its subsidiary has signed an agreement to acquire a gas trading company operating in the Banten region, although they did not provide further details. $RAJA is also in the due diligence stage to acquire 2 shipping companies that own operational assets in the form of 2 Liquefied Natural Gas Carrier (LNGC) units and 1 Very Large Gas Carrier (VLGC) unit. Additionally, $RAJA is conducting due diligence to acquire several New and Renewable Energy (EBT) power plants such as hydropower and biomass plants, as well as the acquisition of a drinking water supply system facility in the Greater Jakarta area.

tickerNews.title: SGER Plans Business Diversification into Nickel Smelting Sector
tickerNews.content: $SGER: Sumber Global Energy President Director, Welly Thomas, stated that they plan to diversify their business by exploring opportunities in the nickel processing sector in collaboration with a smelter in Indonesia. This discussion stage refers to the plan to build a nickel matte converter facility, where this technology will increase the nickel content from previously around 20-30% to 65-75%, thereby increasing the selling price of nickel. Welly believes that the prospect of the high-grade nickel industry remains very promising, supported by increasing global demand for electric vehicles and renewable energy technology.

tickerNews.title: BSDE Marketing Sales Reached Rp 7.1 Trillion in 9M25, Meeting 71% of Target
tickerNews.content: $BSDE: Bumi Serpong Damai recorded marketing sales of approximately 2 trillion Rupiah in 3Q25 (+1% YoY, -24% QoQ). This result brought marketing sales for 9M25 to 7.1 trillion Rupiah (+4% YoY), equivalent to 71% of the 2025 target of 10 trillion Rupiah. The largest contribution to marketing sales came from the 'residential' segment (44.2%), followed by 'shophouses' (26.5%), 'commercial' (15.2%), 'apartments' (5.2%), and 'land plot sales to joint ventures' (8.9%). Previously, Stockbit released a compilation of marketing sales for several other residential issuers here: https://snips.stockbit.com/snips-terbaru/-sektor-properti-kompilasi-marketing-sales-9m25

tickerNews.title: PTRO Net Profit Jumps to US$ 5.9 Million in 3Q25 Driven by Forex Gains
tickerNews.content: $PTRO: Petrosea recorded a net profit of 5.9 million US dollars in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: 0.2 million US dollars, 3Q24: 1.5 million US dollars). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 6.9 million US dollars (vs. 9M24: 2.9 million US dollars), below our expectations (51% of Stockbit 2025F estimate). The 3Q25 net profit was driven by a foreign exchange gain of 17.2 million US dollars (vs. 2Q25: loss of 10.4 million US dollars, 3Q24: loss of 8.3 million US dollars). Operationally, EBITDA reached 38.6 million US dollars in 3Q25 (+7% YoY, -18% QoQ), resulting in EBITDA over 9M25 totaling 109.7 million US dollars (+32% YoY), below expectations (65% of Stockbit 2025F estimate, 54% of management 2025F guidance).

tickerNews.title: Bank Indonesia Credit Growth Slows to 7.7% YoY in 9M25; Credit Demand Remains Weak
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that banking credit growth reached +7.7% YoY as of 9M25 (vs. 8M25: +7.56% YoY, 9M24: +10.85% YoY), lower than the 2025 target which was downgraded by Bank Indonesia to the range of +8-11% YoY. Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, explained that credit demand is still not strong, coinciding with the wait and see attitude from business actors, optimization of internal financing by corporations, and relatively high lending rates. This is reflected in the undisbursed loan value in September 2025 which is still quite large at 22.54% of the total available credit ceiling (vs. 8M25: 22.71%). Based on usage, investment credit grew by +15.18% YoY during 9M25 (vs. 8M25: +13.86% YoY), while consumption credit was +7.42% YoY (vs. 8M25: +7.89% YoY) and working capital +3.37% YoY (vs. 8M25: +3.53% YoY). Meanwhile, MSME credit and Sharia financing growth slowed down to +0.23% YoY and +7.55% YoY respectively. Bank Indonesia estimates that credit growth in 2025 will be at the lower bound of the 2025 target range and will increase in 2026.

tickerNews.title: Gold Prices Plummeted Intraday by 6.3%; Related to Profit Taking and Overvaluation Concerns
tickerNews.content: Spot gold prices briefly plunged by up to -6.3% to the level of 4,082.03 US dollars per troy ounce in Tuesday's (10/21) intraday trading, marking the largest intraday decline since June 2013, before closing down -5.3% at 4,125.22 US dollars per troy ounce. This marks the largest percentage daily decline since August 2020. Bloomberg reported that yesterday's gold price drop was driven by profit-taking actions, amid investor concerns that the recent surge in gold prices might have made them overvalued. On Wednesday (10/22), gold prices fell again by about -1.6% to around 4,058 US dollars per troy ounce.

tickerNews.title: PGAS Gas Sales Volume Misses 9M25 Target; Transmission Volume Exceeds Target
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara ($PGAS) recorded a gas sales volume of 833 BBtud during 9M25 (-2% YoY), which is approximately 4-13% lower than the 2025 target in the range of 873-958 BBtud. Meanwhile, gas transmission volume reached 1,622 MMSCFD during 9M25 (+6% YoY), which is +13% higher than the 2025 target of 1,435 MMSCFD. The upstream sales volume reached 16,892 BOEPD during 9M25 (-16% YoY), which is -2% lower than the 2025 target of 17,227 BOEPD.

tickerNews.title: PWON Revises Down 2025 Marketing Sales Target to Rp 1.35 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Pakuwon Jati ($PWON) revised down its 2025 marketing sales target from 1.8 trillion Rupiah to 1.35 trillion Rupiah. During 9M25, $PWON recorded marketing sales of approximately 903 billion Rupiah (-20% YoY).

tickerNews.title: ADHI New Contract Value in 9M25 Hits Rp 6.5 Trillion, Meeting 23-26% of Target
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya ($ADHI) Corporate Secretary, Rozi Sparta, stated that they recorded a new contract value of 6.5 trillion Rupiah during 9M25 (-54% YoY), equivalent to 23-26% of the 2025 target in the range of 25-28 trillion Rupiah. Based on projects, $ADHI's new contracts during 9M25 originated from building projects (52%), Water Resources (17%), transportation facilities (11%), and others.
